definition: war zone/combat zone/(military) theater of operations

sentences.english: A lot of people here think of Lebanon as the Middle East, as like a war zone.
sentences.chinese: 許多人把黎巴嫩當成中東，就好像一個戰區一樣。

sentences.english: More than two million of our troops and thousands of Foreign Service personnel have served in war zones.
sentences.chinese: 我們二百多萬軍隊和數千名外交人員在戰區服務。

sentences.english: This allows the reader to differentiate between theater and intercontinental assets with ease.
sentences.chinese: 這樣可以讓讀者方便地區分戰區導彈與洲際導彈。

sentences.english: Their families live in their own war zone.
sentences.chinese: 他們的家人住在各自的戰區裏。

sentences.english: The government has launched major redevelopment works in the former northern war zone, popularly known as the Vanni.
sentences.chinese: 政府已推出普遍瓦尼，前北部戰區的大型重建工程。

sentences.english: The China theater posed unique problems for the U. S. military.
sentences.chinese: 中國戰區的情況給美軍提出了獨一無二的難題。

sentences.english: The United States confronted two fundamental challenges in the China theater.
sentences.chinese: 美國在中國戰區需要面對兩個最主要的挑戰。
事情還是上了太平洋戰區公報。

sentences.english: and be like "Oh, well, I was in a war zone, and I fought for you."
sentences.chinese: 就像“噢，我去了戰區，我爲你戰鬥。”

sentences.english: Methods Investigate software and hardware of some army hospital manufacturing laboratory.
sentences.chinese: 方法凋研軍隊部分戰區醫院製劑室的軟硬件現狀。

sentences.english: The team was responsible for clearing minefields in the war zone.
sentences.chinese: 這個小組負責清理戰區的地雷陣。

sentences.english: The logistics of transporting food and supplies to the war zone are extremely complicated.
sentences.chinese: 要運輸食物與補給品到戰區的後勤工作是極度複雜的。

sentences.english: they get surprised, I guess, because it's a war zone.
sentences.chinese: 他們感到驚訝，因爲是戰區。

sentences.english: Operation ICHIGO provoked a major crisis in the China-Burma-India theater.
sentences.chinese: 一號作戰是中印緬戰區遭遇的一個重大危機。

sentences.english: All the letters from the war area were censored.
sentences.chinese: 所有從戰區寄來的信件都經過了檢查。

sentences.english: The army reckons it needs at least two brigades at home to sustain one in a war zone.
sentences.chinese: 部隊估計國內至少需要兩個旅才能維持戰區的一個旅。

definition: commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
geographical area of command/(PLA) military district
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
